titles.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 489 Army Drive in Barrigada, Guam, as the "John Pangelinan Gerber Post Office Building".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E869-870)
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy .

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Lankford moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1843.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Lankford objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 414 - 3 (Roll no. 680). (text: CR 7/28/2011 H5726)

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 207.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: House Oversight and Government Reform
committee.subcommittee: Federal Workforce, U.S. Postal Service, and Labor Policy

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
committee.subcommittee: Federal Financial Management, Government Information, Federal Services, and International Security

bill.summary: 11/8/2011--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 489 Army Drive in Barrigada, Guam, as the "John Pangelinan Gerber Post Office Building."
